properties.notes: On 15 December 2021, FARDC soldiers held 15 women they accused of witchcraft in underground cells in Loashi (Masisi, Nord-Kivu) and raped them, freeing them upon a payment of $200 for each woman's release. [women targeted: accused of witchcraft/sorcery]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Border Security Force
properties.notes: On 13 December 2021, BSF fired at a Pakistani woman attempting to cross the IB at Ranbir Singh Pura sector area (Jammu district, J&K). She was killed in the incident.
On 12 December 2021, in Mindat town (Mindat district, Chin State), the Myanmar military forces randomly opened fire in Mindat town and killed a 40 year-old woman.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
properties.notes: On 12 December 2021, in Kar Li town, Kunhing township (Loilen district, Shan State) No.7 Kar Li People's Militia forces beat two civilians, a 60 year-old man and a 50 year-old woman, at the old market.
On 12 December 2021, government soldiers (SNA) raped and killed a young girl in Janaale town (Marka, Lower Shabelle). [women targeted: girls]

On 11 December 2021, in Ka Det Nge Htein village (Launglon township, Dawei district, Tanintharyi region), the military forces raided a house and cut the female owner of the house as they found political things on her phone. They also beat and arrested two men at a motorcycle shop. They were released with injuries later.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 8 December 2021, Houthi sniper fire targeted and injured 1 civilian woman in Taizz - Madinat an Nur (Al Mudhaffar).
properties.source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project

properties.notes: Around 8 December 2021 (as reported), Taliban forces shot and injured a Hazara girl in Dasht-e Barchi area of Kabul city. The girl was reported to be taken to an unknown location by the Taliban forces. No further information. [women targeted: girls]

On 7 December 2021, in Artemisa, Artemisa, two hooded men entered the house of a female journalist and director of an independent media outlet and beat her, injuring her. Perpetrators did not take anything from the house and left after warning her. According to the victim, state security forces or people sent by them would be responsible for the attack. The beating of the journalist occurred only two days after state security agents raided her home (uncoded). 1 woman was injured.

On 7 December 2021, in Chanmyathazi township (Mandalay district, Mandalay region), following three explosions at the ward administration, the military opened fire in a residential area in Aung Thar Yar ward and killed a five-year-old who was playing in her yard at the house across the ward administration. [women targeted: girls]

On 7 December 2021, a soldier and two of his acolytes are accused of assaulting and attempting to rape a nine-year-old girl and her twelve-year-old brother in Antananarivo (Antananarivo-Renivohitra, Analamanga). The girl was beaten with metal rods on the back and her brother was punched severely, his jaw was dislocated. The girl had the muscles of her pelvis ruptured. [women targeted: girls]
On 6 December 2021, a suspected government soldier (SNA) shot and killed a tuk-tuk driver while injuring two female passengers at the Ceel Garbole village neighborhood in Mogadishu - Karan (Banadir).
On 5 December 2021, Mozambican soldiers raped two women in Memba (Memba, Nampula) after the women asked the soldiers for a lift.

On 5 December 2021, the Moroccan police attacked the home of a pro-Polisario and Human Rights Saharawi activist in Boujdour / Cape Bojador (Boujdour, Laayoune Sakia El Hamra), throwing at her and her family an unknown substance. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 4 December 2021, police and military forces beat and injured four people, including three soccer players and one official, for violating the curfew rules, in an unidentified location in Moyo district (Northern). The group was returning from the Regional Women Football Cup Tournament. There were no fatalities.

On 30 November 2021, an elected female village leader from Yangzhai village (Suzhou, Anhui) was intercepted by petition interceptors in Beijing municipality after submitting evidence of illegal and criminal activities against a village secretary to the National Public Complaints and Proposals Administration. She went incommunicado after being repatriated to her hometown, as reported on 2 December 2021. [women targeted: government officials]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Ethiopia (2018-) Amhara Regional Special Forces
properties.notes: On 30 November 2021, members of Amhara regional special forces shot at a mother and her child after accusing her of feeding TPLF forces in Dabo town in 024 Kebele in Lasta woreda in North Wello zone in Amhara region, injuring the mother and killing the child. Location not found, coded at the largest city of Lasta, Lalibela (Lasta, North Wello, Amhara).

On 29 November 2021, in Ta Khun Taing village, Natmauk township (Magway district, Magway region), Myanmar military force arrested a woman in her 50s at her residence at around 1:30am and beat her for unknown reason.

On 29 November 2021, ten police officers beat a woman (presumed to be Twic Dinka) to death at a police station in Marial Mapel in Aweng payam (assumed to be an alternate name for Maper) (Twic county, Warrap state). The victim was the mother of a suspected cattle thief, whom authorities had been unable to arrest. The officers have been arrested in connection with the killing. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]
On 28 November 2021, police assaulted a woman at the premises of NBA in Kathmandu city (Kathmandu district), while she was trying to enter the Supreme Court to demand a hearing of her case.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 27 November 2021, a Houthi sniper in Hamid hill shot and injured 1 woman in Taizz - Usayfarah (Al Qahirah) as she was leaving her house to fetch water.
properties.source: Yemen Data Project; Khabar News Agency (Yemen)

properties.notes: On 27 November 2021, in Moke Pa Lin village (Kyaikto township, Thaton district, Mon state), a 80-year-old woman who lived in west of the Kyaw Garden and Kyel Sin petrol station was shot and killed by a long-range shot fired by the military forces hiding in the west of the Kyaw Garden while she was coming down to go to the toilet in her home compound.

Around 26 November 2021 (as reported), a case has been opened against police officers in Maphumulo (iLembe, KwaZulu-Natal) who dragged a woman to the police station, stripped her naked and severely assaulted her for failing to wear a facemask in public as per the coronavirus regulations. The woman was denied medical help and was released the following day.

On 25 November 2021, a drunk soldier shot a female student after he tried to sexually assault her and she reacted in Ifotaka (Amboasary-Atsimo, Anosy). The girl died. The soldier was arrested. [women targeted: girls]

On 25 November 2021, a female petitioner and her fellow villager were taken away by police when they passed by the France Embassy in Chaoyang district, Beijing (coded as Beijing - Chaoyang) without a known reason. They were tortured, humiliated, and had their pants forcibly taken off for searching on a car journey before being repatriated to Fuzhou. The next day, the petitioner was detained at a Jin'an government-run 'black jail' in Fuzhou and had remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 10 December 2021.

On 24 November 2021, four petitioner-cum-forced-evictees were intercepted and beat up by Suzhou Gusu Public Complaints and Proposals Administration officers and police upon arriving at Nanjing railway station in Xuanwu district (Nanjing, Jiangsu) when they were on their way to submit petition documents to Nanjing High People's Court. An old petitioner was therefore suffered from tension headache and coma and needed to admit to a hospital. The three others were repatriated to Suzhou city, where an injured female petitioner was detained immediately at a police station in Gusu district.

On 24 November 2021, Zainabiyat women units beat students and teachers as they raided the Prosperity School for girls in Sanaa - Al Ghurzah (Bani Al Harith, Amanat al Asimah) and arrested the school principal. There were no fatalities. The incident took place after the school principal refused to allow the daughter of a Houthi commander to cheat for an exam. [women targeted: girls]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
properties.notes: Around 24 November 2021 (as reported), an officer from the Isleta Police Department raped a woman while she was detained in Albuquerque (New Mexico). The officer arrested the victim in Isleta Pueblo on a traffic charge and drove her to a secluded area near the Metropolitan Detention Center in Albuquerque and raped her. Afterwards he booked her into the Valencia County Detention Center. The victim reported the rape on November 24, 2021, stating that it occurred a few days earlier. The officer said in a police interview that it was a 'lapse in judgement.' He was fired and charged with two counts of criminal sexual penetration, false imprisonment, demanding a bribe, and violation of ethical principles of public service.
On 23 November 2021, in Hpar Hsit village of Kutkai township (Muse district, Shan-North state), a military soldier from LIB 336 raped a 62-year-old woman.
On 23 November 2021, a man in military uniform (and coded as such) raped a 19 year-old mother in Yei town (Yei county, Central Equatoria state).
On 21 November 2021, in Shwe Hlan village (Yesagyo township, Pakokku district, Magway region), the military forces coming down from Kyauk Yit camp, Myaung township shot a young woman dead.

On 21 November 2021, a female petitioner was intercepted by Zhangjiabao Sub-district Office officers at Xi'an Railway Station in Xincheng district (Xian, Shaanxi) as she was traveling to Beijing to submit a petition. A few 'thugs' snatched away her personal belongings and pushed her to the ground, causing her to fall unconscious. She later woke up inside a car in Yandong Unit but was forbidden to seek help from police and medics until she was dumped out of the vehicle on Wenjing road after midnight.

On 21 November 2021, suspected UPDF forces in an omnibus abducted a Muslim leader, together with his wife and mother, in Katikamu (Luwero, Central). The man was suspected of supporting the ADF group. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 20 November 2021, a police officer took a young woman, whom he offered a lift, to the police station in Griffiths Mxenge Building in Zwelitsha (Buffalo City, Eastern Cape) and raped her. The officer was arrested.

On 20 November 2021, in Se village, Myaung township (Sagaing district, Sagaing region), around 80 Myanmar military troops arrested a woman at around 8 am and used her as human shield. Three houses were also burned down.

On 19 November 2021, police officers arrested a group of women after prayers at the mosque and took them to the police station in Nairobi (Starehe, Nairobi). The women was forced to strip naked and was then assaulted with stinging nettles and had to undergo invasive body searches and were later released. One women was found dead after being released.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
properties.assoc_actor_2_primary: Police Forces of the United States (2021-)
properties.notes: On 19 November 2021, a sergeant attempted to pepper spray a suspect who was already restrained in a police vehicle in Sunrise (Florida). A woman officer pulled the sergeant away from the suspect, at which point the sergeant turned on the officer and grabbed her by the throat and pushed her against a patrol car. An internal affairs investigation is ongoing.
On 18 November 2021, in Na Bar village (Indaw township, Katha district, Sagaing region), the military arrested a freelance journalist. She was beaten during the arrest and her belongings were seized.

Around 18 November 2021 (as reported), a woman who spoke out about a Taliban commander attempting to rape her the week prior (coded in a separate event), was killed by the Taliban in Afghanistan (coded to Mahmood Raqi Kapisa with GP3 where she was a resident, no further info on the location). She was sister of a former military soldier and she was beaten and tortured by the Taliban commander last week because she refused to accept his sexual demand. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 16 November 2021, in Hpa Laung Taung village (Hpa-An township, Hpa-An district, Kayin state), the joint forces of the military and the Border Guard Force shot and wounded two female students returning from school.
On 15 November 2021, one police officer and one gendarme gang raped a woman that they held in custordy at the police station of Kinieran town (Mandiana, Kankan).

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Kazakhstan (2019-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: Around 15 November 2021, a female prison guard was raped by her superior at the police detention facility in the town of Ridder in East Kazakhstan region following which victim filed a report to press charges against her male colleague.

On 15 November 2021, in Holguin, Holguin, police officers beat and violently arrested three activists -two women and a man- and an elderly woman, on their way to participate in the anti-government demonstration 'Civic March for Change' scheduled for the day. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 15 November 2021, police abducted a female CNL supporter, who is also a teacher, from Kanyami neighborhood of Ngozi city (Ngozi, Ngozi). She has not yet been found. [women targeted: political party supporters]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Ivory Coast (2011-)
properties.notes: On 14 November 2021, during the night, the military forces gang raped 5 women and destroyed stolen properties during a raid against illegal mining in Lagbo village, Doropo subdivision (Bounkani, Zanzan).

On 14 November 2021, in Yekyi Pauk village (Amarapura township, Mandalay district, Mandalay region), a 13-year-old kid was taken hostage by the military after his 55-year-old father who is the supporter of the National League for Democracy (NLD) can not be located. His wife was also beaten by the military troops.

On 14 November 2021, in Soacha (Cundinamarca), a woman, who is an activist, was attacked by a police officer who responded to a call reporting a street fight in the area. The victim claimed that the officer approached her when the man recognized her, pushed her to the ground and hit her with the baton while referring to her work as an activist. The victim has organized several protests demanding the truth in a case in which several prisoners died during a fire at a local jail in September 2020. There were no fatalities. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]
On 13 November 2021, police officers (gendarmerie) hit the motorcycle of a journalist from ORTC in Mutsamudu (Mutsamudu, Anjouan), injuring her.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
properties.assoc_actor_2_primary: Batwa Ethnic Group (Democratic Republic of Congo)
properties.notes: On 12 November 2021, the FARDC killed two children of the Batwa ethnic group and injured two women in Mubambiro (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). [women targeted: girls]

On 12 November 2021, in Soledad (Atlantico), a woman police officer was sexually assaulted by one of her superiors at the police station. According to the victim, the officer called her to a private office and subsequently touched her and ejaculated on her. [women targeted: government officials]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Myanmar (2021-) People's Militia Force
properties.notes: On 12 November 2021, in Lashio town of Lashio township (Lashio district, Shan-North state), a (unreported) people's militia abducted 7 women from Namhkhan and Namhsam, promising them a job. The militia threatened them to attend military training and beat one woman who said she would go home. They were all released on November 29.
Around 12 November 2021 (as reported), 2 young girls were gang raped by the Taliban forces in Yusof Mirzayee village of Andkhoy district, Faryab. [women targeted: girls]

On 11 November 2021, in Maubin town (Maubin District, Ayeyarwady Region), the police forces arrested a woman who was two months pregnant and tortured her to death for suspicion of stealing gold and other valuable items from house of deputy administrator from the general administration department.

On 11 November 2021, in Kyauk Kar village of Palaw township (Myeik district, Tanintharyi region), the military forces shot and killed a female rubber plantation worker while clearing the area for no reason.
properties.source: Karen Information Center News; Democratic Voice of Burma; Ministry of Defense - NUG

properties.notes: Around 11 November 2021 (as reported), an Afghan woman claimed that Taliban forces tortured and beat her after she refused to accept their sexual demand in Kabul province. She said that she is sister of a former Afghan government soldier. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 11 November 2021, in Akluai village (Tedim township, Falam district, Chin state), three military soldiers from the 22nd Light Infantry Headquarters raped a 27-year-old woman who gave birth just one and a half months ago in a house. She was raped multiple times in a night and her husband was beaten. Two of these three military soldiers also raped a seven months pregnant woman in the bathroom and confiscated her earrings.

Around 10 November 2021 (week of), a female member of the Central Sudanese Doctors Committee was subjected to verbal and physical harassment and beatings by regular forces (assumed police) while being in detention in El Obeid (Sheikan locality, North Kordofan state). [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 10 November 2021, in Puerto Berrio (Antioquia), a female soldier was sexually assaulted by one of her superiors inside the military base facilities. The victim stated that the man physically assaulted her until she lost consciousness. After recovering, she was taken to a hospital, where doctors confirmed the sexual abuse. The victim claimed that the military officer had tried to hide her case to avoid scandal.

On 8 November 2021, the Moroccan police attacked the home of a pro-Polisario and Human Rights Saharawi activist in Boujdour / Cape Bojador (Boujdour, Laayoune Sakia El Hamra), injuring her and her mother and sister. They also threw an unknown susbtance at her. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders][women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 8 November 2021 (as reported), a female activist from Shangqiu city, Henan (coded to Suiyang), went missing. Her appearance came after her online activism, urging for the immediate release of jailed citizen journalist Zhang Zhan, who was close to death during an intermittent hunger strike to protest her imprisonment for reporting news from Wuhan in the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic. It was suspected that she was taken away by the police. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 7 November 2021, in Pauk Pin village of Monywa township (Monywa district, Sagaing region), military soldiers went to the wrong house in search of a protest leader and shot at a woman who ran from shock. She was then brought in the car and the military sent her dead body back to the house next day.

On 7 November 2021, in Hpar Khit village of Kutkai township (Muse district, Shan-North state), a soldier from the military LIB-336 raped a 62-year-old woman while she was home alone after soldiers stole food from her home. The soldier was reported to the relevant senior officer.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: On 7 November 2021, SNR agents abducted a young woman in Kajaga (Mutimbuzi, Bujumbura Rural). Her brother was abducted in October, accused of partnering with rebel groups (coded separately). [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 7 November 2021, Belarusian armed forces, likely border guards, were pushing migrant women and children over the barbed-wire Polish border fence and forming a human shield to prevent them from returning to Belarus. [coded to Grodno] [women targeted: girls]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Municipal Guards
properties.notes: On 5 November 2021, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone (Sao Paulo), a transgender woman was attacked by a municipal guard in the Luz neighborhood, in the Cracolandia region. The municipal guard verbally assaulted her and fired rubber bullets into her abdomen, as she was walking on the streets. There were no fatalities.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
properties.notes: On 5 November 2021, recruits of the FARDC attacked civilians in the village of Belatshola, located in the territory of Moanda (Kongo-Central). Sources suggest the FARDC recruits came into the village to avenge the death of a fellow companion who was found dead in this village. During the attack, they set ablaze several houses, raped women, and injured several people. 2 people (a couple) were killed.

On 5 November 2021, in Myaing township (Pakokku District, Magway Region), Myanmar military forces in civilian clothes took away local women which were used as human shields during a clash (clash coded separately), according to PDF-Myaing.

On 5 November 2021, the wife of a detained rights defender was taken away by three police officers in the Huaihe neighborhood of Xi County (Xinyang, Henan) and held at a local hostel. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 2 November 2021, a high-ranked female tennis player Peng Shuai, who was a doubles champion at Wimbledon and the French Open, went missing and became incommunicado in Beijing municipality after she accused former vice-premier Zhang Gaoli of pressuring her into a sexual relationship in a social media post. It was the first time that the #MeToo movement had reached the highest echelons of the ruling CCP. The tennis players' disappearance raised international concerns about her personal safety and whereabouts.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
properties.notes: On 30 October 2021, two NSS officers beat an Ethiopian bartender into a coma in Aweil town (Aweil West county, Northern Bahr el Ghazal state), after she insisted they pay for the drinks they consumed. A nearby police patrol arrested the attackers.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of North Korea (2011-) Border Guard
properties.notes: Around 30 October 2021 (week of), border security soldiers arrested a woman in her 20s in Hoeryong City who attempted to defect to China due to difficulties in living. Officials of the preliminary hearing security guards physically attacked and sexually assaulted the woman. At last, she killed herself on 30 October.

On 30 October 2021, a female activist was taken away by local government officers in Beijing municipality and became incommunicado, as reported on 8 November 2021. Her disappearance came after her online activism urging for the immediate release of jailed citizen journalist Zhang Zhan, who was close to death during an intermittent hunger strike to protest her imprisonment for reporting news from Wuhan in the early days of the COVID-19 pandemic. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 30 October 2021, 5 petitioner-cum-forced-evictee, including 3 women, from Fuzhou was beat up and abducted by 4-5 interceptors inside Dashilan Police Station in Xicheng district, Beijing (coded as Beijing - Xicheng) without any intervention from the police. The petitioners were separated into two groups and transferred to a farmhouse in Shipai Village in Fuzhou city and a farmhouse on 115 Xiu Feng Lu road in Fuzhou city, where they were subjected to violence and physically restrained. They were all released on 16 November 2021.
On 29 October 2021, in Kywe Te village of Taze township (coded as Taze) (Shwebo district, Sagaing region), the military forces stationed at the Kywe Te village shot and arrested a woman.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
properties.notes: On 29 October 2021, in San Cristobal (Tachira), suspected PNB officers shot and killed a woman during an attempt at extortion. Authorities initially reported the attack occurred during a common robbery; however, family members refuted the narrative of a robbery, stating the perpetrators were PNB officers engaged in systematic extortion of workers in the area. 1 fatality.

On 27 October 2021, in El Estor, Izabal, police officer physically assaulted and injured a female human rights defender, member of the Artisanal Fishermen's Union of El Estor and the Mayan Q'eqchi indigenous group. This incident follows a state of siege declared by the government to restore public order after clashes between demonstrators and police officers recorded between 22 and 23 October (coded separately). [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Sudan (2019-) Rapid Support Forces
properties.notes: On 26 October 2021, members of RSF attacked female university students at dormitories in Khartoum (Khartoum state). No further details reported.

Around 25 October 2021 (as reported), in Tapachula municipality, Chiapas (coded to Tapachula de Cordova y Ordonez), a migrant woman from Haiti was killed and her body was found strangle on the Jaritas-Suchiate highway. According to witnesses, municipal police officers arrested her previously. One month later four municipal police officer from Suchaite were arrested for this killing. 1 fatality.

Around 25 October 2021, in Quilmes (Buenos Aires), police officers beat a woman up, took her to the police station, undressed her, and filmed her. The police invaded her house, located in a dangerous neighborhood, as they did on other occasions to carry out searches and attacked her after she started filming their actions. In the following days, she was taken to a hearing for resisting authority.

On 24 October 2021, in Homalin town (Homalin Township, Hkamti District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided a house of a protest leader at night. During the raid, his sister-in-law who was also a teacher who joined the civil disobedience movement was shot and killed by the military. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders][women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]
properties.source: Myanmar Now; Democratic Voice of Burma

properties.notes: On 22 October 2021, a female rights defender-cum-forced evicted was beaten up by Xinjiekou Residential District officials at her residential area in Maqun Sub-district of Qixia district (Nanjing, Jiangsu) when she tried to stop them from monitoring her by taking videos. She suffered neck injuries and needed to be hospitalized. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance in relation to the sixth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee set to commence in Beijing. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 22 October 2021, Xinjiekou Residential District Stability Maintenance Office officers raided the house of a female human rights activist in Xuanwu district (Nanjing, Jiangsu) and beat her up, forcing her not to follow up her case of illegal demolition. She sustained six rib fractures and injuries over the body, resulting in hospitalization for half a month. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 21 October 2021, a female forced eviction petitioner was beaten up by local government personnel from Xinjiekou Residential District at Xuanwu district (Nanjing, Jiangsu), causing her to suffer from neck injuries and fractured coccyx and breastbone. The incident was reported as a case of stability maintenance before the sixth plenary session of the 19th CPC Central Committee in Beijing.

On 18 October 2021, a woman was placed under residential surveillance in a designated location by police in Pinghai township (Putian, Fujian) on suspicion of supplying food for her ex-husband - a now-deceased murder suspect. Her arrest came after her ex-husband killed himself in a cave as authorities closed in to arrest him for allegedly murdering two people and injuring three others in a land dispute on 10 October 2021. The suicide of the murder suspect drew national attention and elicited an outpouring of sympathy for the accused. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 17 October 2021, in Alto Guajira parish (coded to Neima, Zulia), soldiers reportedly detained, beat, and fired shots at two Wayuu indigenous people in Kasusay community. Witnesses stated the victims had not committed any crimes, were detained while walking outside, and that the soldiers furthermore beat up indigenous elders, children, and pregnant women in the area. At least two injured, no fatalities.

On 16 October 2021, a disabled female petitioner from Changchun, Jilin, went missing and became incommunicado at Changchun Railway Station in Kuancheng district (Changchun, Jilin) at the night she was planning to travel to Beijing to petition at the Central Military Commission. Earlier the night, she was called by the police several times to instruct her not to go petitioning.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
properties.notes: Around 15 October 2021 (as reported), 2 elements of the FARDC raped a woman in Nyange, 40 km of Misisi (Fizi, Sud-Kivu), while they were on patrol.

Around 15 October 2021 (month of), police were reported to have been beating women (presumed to be Bor Dinka) who were wearing trousers or short skirts in Bor town (Bor South county, Jonglei state). In some cases, police were reported to have torn or cut off short skirts from the women.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
properties.notes: Around 15 October 2021 (month of), FACA forces raped a woman in an unidentified location in Vakaga prefecture (coded as Birao). There were no fatalities.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 13 October 2021, a Houthi sniper shot and killed a civilian woman in Ash Sharaf (As Silw, Taizz).
properties.source: Al Mashhad Al Araby; Yemen Data Project

properties.notes: Around 13 October 2021, a police officer and a former police officer raped a woman in Chevelcha, Poltava. The woman was hospitalised.
On 12 October 2021, a police personnel raped a woman, while 2 other men stood guard, in Bhilai town (Durg, Chhattisgarh). Police have arrested all 3 assailants.

On 10 October 2021, in Barranquilla (Atlantico), police officers attacked a trans woman in a suspected homophobic attack. There are no further details on the attack, but sources claimed the victim suffered several injuries and medical complications due to the incident. There were no fatalities.

On 10 October 2021, a woman was killed in Chaparhar district, Nangarhar. An eyewitness claimed that she was killed by the Taliban forces and her body was dumped in Sera Qala area of Chaparhar district, Nangarhar. The reason behind her killing is unclear.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: On 9 October 2021, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone, Rio de Janeiro, a prison guard raped a woman who was a detainee in a detention centre in the Benfica neighborhood. The guard deceived the victim and trapped her in a bathroom of the facility. He confessed to the crime after a co-worker reported the attack to the prison director.

On 8 October 2021, a woman was verbally threatened or physically attacked by demolition office personnel in Xincun Residential District of Jiang'an district (Wuhan, Hubei). Officers locked her in a car for a few hours and beat her to the ground before releasing her. She had to be hospitalized for brain concussion.

On 8 October 2021, a woman flagged by a police officer at a coronavirus quarantine checkpoint was raped by the said officer in Mabalacat City (Pampanga, Central Luzon). The woman reportedly failed to show a driver's license at the checkpoint. She was then made to ride the police officer's car, who then reportedly brought her to a motel and raped her. Rape charges were filed against the police officer, who was also dismissed from service.
properties.source: ABS-CBN; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Star

properties.notes: On 6 October 2021, a 16-year-old female student was assaulted and injured by a police officer at the principal's office in the building of high school 43 in Shymkent city following which victim was hospitalized with concussion. A student's parent filed a police report. [women targeted: girls]

On 5 October 2021, police forces attacked a woman in her house for unclear reasons in Ngogwe (Buikwe, Central). Due to the increasing number of attacks perpetrated by police forces against civilians, 14 local councilors resigned. There were no fatalities nor injuries.

On 5 October 2021, in Dwei Loe village of Hpapun township (coded as Hpapun) (Hpapun district, Kayin state), the military's LIB 405 used six villagers including 4 women and 2 men from Waw Wi Lay village to carry food and guide them in the battlefield. Of six villagers, a 60-year-old woman was injured in times of fighting.

On 5 October 2021, in Tha Pyay Thar village of Myingyan township (Myingyan district, Mandalay region), the military and police beat and arrested three women, family members of their intended target. They also arrested a 60-year-old man. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]
On 4 October 2021, a member of the ENDF raped a woman in kebele 017 in Tehuledere woreda (Ambasel, South Wello, Amhara).

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Municipal Guards
properties.notes: On 30 September 2021, in Sao Paulo - Central Zone, Sao Paulo, three municipal guards assaulted and injured a Black transgender woman in the Cracolandia region. She was seeking donations for the social organization at which she worked, when a municipal guard approached her and made her raise her skirt. The guard threw pepper spray at the victim's face and two other officers assaulted her with nightsticks while she was asking for help. The guard was removed from the position one week after. There were no fatalities.

On 30 September 2021, in Buenos Aires (Ciudad Autonoma de Buenos Aires), more than 200 families (led by mothers) were evicted from an abandoned building in Villa 31 area by police officers who beat them and set fire to their tents. The group also reported that officers threatened to remove a mother's custody of her daughter in case she did not leave the place and accepted the government's financial assistance.

On 29 September 2021, Taliban entered and searched the house of a former police woman, tortured her and her 9 years old son in Kabul city. They were looking for her gun. [women targeted: government officials]

On 28 September 2021, some female members of the IMN were beaten by soldiers and an unspecified number of other members were arrested along the Abuja-Kaduna expressway (location coded to Abuja Municipal, FCT).

On 28 September 2021, a female petitioner from Qianjiang city was intercepted by petition interceptors at Beijing West Railway Station in Fengtai District, Beijing (coded as Beijing - Fengtai) and detained at Qi Lu Qing Hotel in Haidian District. On the next day, She was allowed to leave the hotel briefly to submit a petition in a bank under police surveillance. She was subjected to stability maintenance operation for three days in Beijing, and the incident was allegedly related to heightened security measures ahead of Chinese National Day.

On 27 September 2021, members of the police assaulted two women and a male lawyer in El Deim neighborhood in Khartoum (Khartoum state). One of the women sustained injuries on the face and the lawyer was beaten on the head, face, and ears. The reason for the attacks is unclear.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-) School Resource Officer
properties.notes: On 27 September 2021, a school resource officer shot Mona Rodriguez near Millikan High School in Long Beach (California). Rodriquez was allegedly in a verbal altercation with a girl that the officer de-escalated by 'threatening to pepper-spray them.' After the fight, Rodriguez got into her boyfriend's car, which the officer shot at as it drove away. There are no indications that anyone in the car was armed and it is unclear why the officer fired into the vehicle. At least one demonstration against the event followed. [women targeted: girls]

On 27 September 2021, police forces allegedly raided a house and beat a woman in Sahiwal city (Sahiwal (Sahiwal), Punjab), after failing to find the suspect they were looking for. The woman's fingers were broken as a result of the beating.
On 26 September 2021, suspected military forces shot and killed a woman in Barombi Kotto village, Kumba town, Ekondo Titi subdivision (Ndian, Sud-Ouest).

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
properties.notes: On 25 September 2021, in Guarapari, Espirito Santo, a Black woman was beaten up and injured by military police forces during an intervention. Footage of the event shows the woman being punched in the face even after being immobilized. The officers were suspended and an investigation on the case was requested by the Prosecution's Office. There were no fatalities.

On 25 September 2021, a group of four women were shot with rubber bullets and attacked by police officers, part of the National Intervention Unit, in Cape Town - Delft (City of Cape Town, Western Cape) after the group declined the officers' advances. At least one woman was injured by a rubber bullet. Four police officers were arrested, but later released.
On 25 September 2021, a woman involved in a decades-long land dispute was placed under Residential Surveillance at a Designated Location (RSDL) in Fushan (Yantai, Shandong).

On 24 September 2021, a female petitioner from Wuhan, Hubei, was intercepted by Wuhan stability maintenance officers and Beijing private security in Beijing. On the next day, she was escorted back to Wuhan and forcibly admitted to the psychiatric ward of Wuhan Hanyang Hospital. On 2 October 2021, the police arrested 10 of her supporters, attempting to rescue her from the hospital.

On 24 September 2021, in Santiago - Nunoa (Metropolitana), a police officer used excessive force during the arrest of a woman, who is also a current member of the Constituent Assembly. The incident occurred when police responded to a domestic violence call. A video leaked to the press shows the officer grabbing the victim by the neck and slamming her against a vehicle for her arrest. The woman reported injuries due to the incident. [women targeted: politicians]

On 23 September 2021, seven armed men on camels who dressed in the forces of unspecified 'regular' soldiers (and provisionally coded as SAF) shepherded a large number of camels and cattle into farms in the Tengara area of Tawila locality (North Darfur state) [coded to Tawila]. The attackers severely assaulted female farmers in the area.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Uzbekistan (2016-) National Security Service
properties.notes: On 22 September 2021, a female resident of Yakkabag district in Kashkadarya region was assaulted by the National Guard servicemen and police officers at the district administration's office in Yakkabog township following victim's attempt to file a complaint which resulted in her hospitalization.
On 21 September 2021, soldiers abducted and tortured 2 women and a man near Buringa (Gihanga, Bubanza). The civilians were returned afterwards to Buringa with serious injuries.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Russia (2000-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: Around 20 September 2021 (week of), a female inmate at prison nr. 1 in Blagoveshchensk was allegedly beaten by guards just before her release. According to the victim, the attack occurred after she refused to have her fingerprints taken, as well as due to the fact she was successful in her application to a local court, in which she demanded to be released from custody.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 18 September 2021, a Houthi sniper shot and injured 1 girl in Al Asaq village (Maqbanah, Taizz). [women targeted: girls]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)
properties.notes: On 18 September 2021, a woman was killed by a police officer at the Rubaya mining site in or around Rubaya (Masisi, Nord-Kivu). The motivation for the attack is not reported.
Around 17 September 2021 (as reported), Taliban entered a house where a wedding party was ongoing and beat a group of women who were listening to music in Takhar province (coded to Taluqan with GP3).

On 16 September 2021, in Ywar Ma, 115 mile in Muse Township, Muse District, Shan State, a car carrying military soldiers and PMF troops hit two women who were walking on the street. One died and one injuried. Fatalities coded as 1.

On 15 September 2021, a female petitioner-cum-forced-evictee was taken away by Fengdu county police and government officers near her residence at Liangjiang New Area in Yubei District, Chongqing, and remained incommunicado at the time of reporting on 17 September 2021. She had been a target of the state for many years for her petitioning.

On 15 September 2021, in Se Taw village (Kale Township, Kale District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military soldiers entered the village and fired gunshots indiscriminately. A bullet injured an elderly woman.
Around 15 September 2021 (month of), a soldier from the 12th Corps dispatched to Kapsan County (Ryanggang) sexually assaulted a woman.

On 15 September 2021, in Aungpan Town (Kalaw Township, Taunggyi District, Shan South), the Myanmar military arrested a daughter of a veteran. The reason for the arrest was unknown. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 14 September 2021, in Taung Bet village (Pauk Township, Pakokku District, Magway Region), the pro-military group Pyu Saw Htee and military soldiers detained and killed a woman. She worked as an accountant for Pauk People's Defense Force. The military also took 180 lakhs Myanmar kyats when they detained him.
properties.source: Democratic Voice of Burma; Myanmar Now

properties.notes: Around 13 September 2021 (as reported), a women was shot and killed by the Taliban forces in Kabul province. She as stated to be pregnant, no information on the motive.
On 12 September 2021, Houthi Zainabiyat women forces beat up and arrested several women as they raided houses in Rahban village (Dimnat Khadir, Taizz). The reason behind the arrests was not reported.

On 12 September 2021, a woman was tortured and killed by police officers during interrogation in Chivhu (Chikomba, Mashonaland East). The victim was being accused of concealing money stolen by her sister.

On 12 September 2021, an underage girl was allegedly beaten by a police officer at a police station in Berdsk, where she had been taken following a complaint filed by her mother and grandmother, who claimed to have asked for police intervention after the girl refused to return home. [women targeted: girls]
Around 11 September 2021, a police officer beat up a woman during an altercation at a police checkpoint in Obeagu (Agwu, Enugu).

properties.assoc_actor_2_primary: Former Police Forces of Afghanistan (2021-) National Directorate of Security
properties.notes: On 11 September 2021, 1 former NDS official home was raided by Taliban members in Kandahar city. He and his sister were beaten. The sister was shot in the leg. They were arrested and later released after posts of the arrest went viral on social media. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 11 September 2021, Taliban shot and killed a woman belonging to Hazara ethnic group in Mahtab Qala area of Kabul city. The Taliban denied involvement and blamed thieves for her killing. Witnesses said it was Taliban.
properties.source: Rukhshana Media; Hasht-e Subh; Etilaat e Roz

properties.notes: On 10 September 2021, a policeman killed a civilian woman at her mother's shop during a raid in Surulere (Mushin, Lagos).

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: On 9 September 2021, SNR agents abducted 2 Twa women who were recently repatriated from Tanzania, in Kirundo province.

On 6 September 2021, a teenage girl was severely beaten and injured by a police officer in a police station of the Rasta neighborhood, Kilamba Kiaxi (Luanda, Luanda). The girl went to the station to gather information about her two sisters who were arrested earlier. The attack happened after an argument between the officer and the teenager. The officer was arrested. [women targeted: girls]

On 6 September 2021, a shepherd was shot by a soldier in the village of Mourbame (Lac Lere, Mayo Kebbi Ouest). The victim tried to intervene when the soldier was sexually assaulting a young girl. [women targeted: girls]
On 4 September 2021, The Taliban killed a woman who was an ex member of the Afghan police in Chaghcharan city, Ghor. She was pregnant. Taliban rejected the allegations.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 2 September 2021, Houthi forces shot and injured a civilian girl in Al Hamili (Mawza, Taizz). [women targeted: girls]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 1 September 2021, Houthi forces assaulted and beat up female students in the College of Medicine of Ibb University (Al Dhihar, Ibb), as well as the Vice-President of the College, as they were celebrating the return of one of their classmates after an accident. On 1 September 2021, in Thea Ein village (Paung Township, Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar military shot a pregnant woman and also a mother of a 4-year-old child dead. She was shot on her way back home after greeting a couple returning home from a river after fishing.
On 1 September 2021, in Kyainseikgyi township (Kawkareik District, Kayin State), the Myanmar military abducted a 30-year-old woman as a hostage after the Myanmar military and KNLA clashed.

On 1 September 2021, in Cartagena (Bolivar), an informal vendor reported a suspected case of police abuse during a routine police operation. According to the report, officers arrived at the area following a call for public disorder. In the middle of the argument, an officer pushed an elderly woman, causing injuries to her shoulder and hip as a result of a fall.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 31 August 2021, Houthi forces killed an elderly woman in front of her sons in Al Ashah district (Amran). The reason for the killing was not reported.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Kyrgyzstan (2017-2020) Prison Guards
properties.notes: Around 30 August 2021, a female guard physically and sexually assaulted female detainees at the police detention facility 53 in Jalal-Abad city which was reported by the National Torture Prevention Committee.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Romania (2019-2020) Border Police
properties.notes: Around 28 August 2021, a customs employee hit and choked a woman who was crossing the border checkpoint near Siret. The border police denies that there had been an attack.

On 27 August 2021, a police officer and a civilian volunteer allegedly raped and molested a woman in Mariveles town (Bulacan, Central Luzon), after apprehending her for supposed violations of coronavirus quarantine protocol. The accused officer and volunteer, who were both manning a quarantine checkpoint from which they flagged the woman, allegedly brought the woman to the house of the police officer. The woman subsequently filed cases against the 2 accused, who were both arrested by the police.
properties.source: Philippine News Agency; Rappler; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Philippine Star; Manila Bulletin

properties.notes: On 27 August 2021, at the town entry gate of Pale township (Yinmarbin district, Sagaing region), the military forced everyone who passed through to get down on their knees and raise their hands. The military touched the private parts of women as they inspected the women.

Around 25 August 2021 (between 19 - 29 August), in Jalipa, Colima, a woman was killed and her body was found. The victim was kidnapped on 19 August in Manzanillo allegedly by municipal police officers. The perpetrators asked for a ransom. Her family paid 80.000 pesos out of 400.000 that were asked. She was found dead ten days later. Two municipal police officers were arrested. 1 fatality.

On 24 August 2021, subdistrict CCP and government officials leading over 100 police and officers forcibly took away an old woman and her daughter from their house at Huajin village, Gusu district (Suzhou, Jiangsu), and detained them at a local hostel. The officers then demolished their house, citing a compulsory demolition notice announced on the day.

On 24 August 2021, military forces opened fire on civilians in Ekombe Bonji town, Kumba 1 subdivision (Meme, Sud-Ouest), killing two Nigerian young girls and injuring a Cameroonian boy. The attack in retaliation after an IED detonated and missed them on their way to the town. [women targeted: girls]

On 22 August 2021, during a raid on the house of a pro-Polisario female Saharawi activist, policemen sexually harassed her and her sister inside their home in Boujdour / Cape Bojador (Laayoune-Sakia El Hamra, Bojador). Other members of her family were injured during the police raid.

Around 20 August 2021 (between 18 August - 22 August), in Caucagua (Miranda), police forces reportedly tortured farmers, women, and elderly people during a vehicle theft investigation spanning across Capilito, La Arenita, and Monton sectors. The perpetrators reportedly threatened to rape and plant drugs on the victims if they reported the abuses. No fatalities occurred.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of South Sudan (2011-) National Security Service
properties.notes: On 20 August 2021, 15 women were gang raped by NSS and SSPDF personnel at or near to Maiku village (Tambura county, Western Equatoria state), after the women had escaped captivity from an unidentified militia. The government personnel had accused the women of being rebel spies.

On 19 August 2021, 4 men including 3 Gram Rakshak Dal (police) members raped a minor girl near Khakharia Narmada canal in Savli block (Vadodara, Gujarat), after she was 'caught' sitting with a boy at the canal. Police have arrested 3 assailants. [women targeted: girls]

properties.assoc_actor_2_primary: AMIHAN: National Federation of Peasant Women
properties.notes: On 19 August 2021, a woman farmer leader was killed, while her husband and her son were wounded, in an alleged strafing attack by suspected military elements in Maramag town (Bukidnon, Northern Mindanao). The slain farmer was a local leader of AMIHAN, while her husband was a member of local KMP affiliate KASAMA Bukidnon. Both farmers' organizations have often been red-tagged by the military. The couple also belongs to Buffalo-Tamaraw-Limus (BTL), a local peasant group claiming agricultural lands also claimed by the Central Mindanao University. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]
On 19 August 2021, a police officer sexually assaulted a woman while on duty in Sherbrooke (Quebec). He was arrested on November 4, 2021. No fatalities.

On 18 August 2021, a woman from Gaokeng town (Pingxiang city, Jiangxi Province) was abducted by local government officers at her home after submitting petitions at the Public Complaints and Proposals Administration. She was then held at the psychiatry department at Pingkuang General Hospital in Anyuan district, Jiangxi province, for so-called 'compulsory mental health treatment'. She was denied visits by her friends.

On 18 August 2021, a woman from Gaokeng town (Pingxiang city, Jiangxi Province) was abducted by local government officers at her home after submitting petitions at the Public Complaints and Proposals Administration. She was then held at the psychiatry department at Pingkuang General Hospital in Anyuan district, Jiangxi province, for so-called 'compulsory mental health treatment.' She was denied visits by her friends, forced to take many psychiatric drugs, and subjected to violence when she refused to obey. She was released on 25 August 2021.

On 15 August 2021, in Villarrica (Guaira), police officers beat and illegally detained a woman who was requesting them to stop beating her son, suspect of robbery. The woman was detained for five days without a court order. The D. A. Office was investigating the police for torture.

On 15 August 2021, in Soledad (Atlantico), a trans-woman claimed she was harassed and physically assaulted by a group of police officers in a suspected homophobic attack. The officers chased the victim down the street and assaulted her psychically while shouting discriminatory expletives at her. The victim claimed that her sexual identity triggered the attack as officers forced her to show her breast to them. There were no fatalities.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of India (2014-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: Around 15 August 2021 (month of), 2 prison guards raped a female prisoner on parole in Alirajpur city (MP). Both assailants were arrested in December 2021.

On 14 August 2021, two men in military uniforms (and provisionally coded as SSPDF) entered a house in Torit town (Torit county, Eastern Equatoria state), abducted three children (two girls and one boy) and beating the elder sister of the abductees. [women targeted: girls]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
properties.notes: On 13 August 2021, in Passos, Minas Gerais, a Black woman was injured by rubber bullets shot by a military police officer during an intervention. The officer claimed self-defense, as he was beaten up by the woman, but a recording of the event shows the officer shot the woman unprovoked.

Around 13 August 2021 (as reported), a woman was assaulted from the back and kicked to the ground by police personnel at Tianfu Road Police Station in Wendeng District, Shandong, leaving her unconscious. It was reported that the woman was retaliated against during a dispute with the police after filing a complaint against a government department director.

On 13 August 2021, near Waingmaw town (Waingmaw Township, Myitkyina District, Kachin State), the Myanmar military battalion-58 shot at a couple on a motorcycle who were passing through a road in front of the battalion as they were returning home from grocery shopping in Waingmaw on the evening. The wife was killed while the husband managed to escape.
properties.source: Network Media Group; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Kachin News Group; Kachinland News

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
properties.notes: On 12 August 2021, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone, Rio de Janeiro, military police officers shot and killed a Black woman in the Chapadao Complex. The victim was a street seller. According to police, officers were attacked by armed suspects, but witnesses stated that no shoot-out was taking place. 1 fatality.
properties.source: G1; Voz das Comunidades; O Dia (Brazil)

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
properties.notes: On 11 August 2021, military forces beat and seriously injured a woman for allegedly refusing to stop at their checkpoint in Begoua (Bimbo, Ombella-M'Poko). No fatalities were reported.
On 11 August 2021, a police officer raped a woman at a police station in Lyublino district in Moscow - South-Eastern, after detaining her for an unspecified cause.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 11 August 2021, Houthi sniper fire killed 1 civilian woman in Al Matahin in Al Quhayfah area (Maqbanah, Taizz).

properties.notes: On 10 August 2021, between Kyoe Waing and Myit Kyoe village (Bilin Township, Thaton District, Mon State), the Myanmar military IB-406 and BGF battalion 1013 used women as human shields as they advanced towards Kyoe Waing from Myit Kyoe village.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
properties.notes: On 9 August 2021, in Juquia, Sao Paulo, military police officers were checking reports of breaking social distance measures enforced due to the coronavirus pandemic, when a woman started arguing with officers. Others argued with police and, according to a video footage, one officer grabbed the woman by her hair and dragged her around until she fell to the ground. According to a witness, the officer continued to pull her hair while she was on the floor, injuring the victim. The woman was arrested for disobedience and resistance.
On 8 August 2021, the military forces shot and killed one woman during a raid in Ndop town (Ngo-Ketunjia, Nord-Ouest).

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

The FARDC subsequently denied the allegations. A man was also injured.

On 5 August 2021, a female UN staff member (who is South Sudanese) was assaulted by SSPDF and SSNPS at an unspecified location along the road to Paloich (assumed to be a reference to Paloc, which is also known as Paloich) in Rumbek East county (Lakes state) [coded to Paloc]. The source speculates the attack was in retaliation for a critical press statement issued by the UN Mission in South Sudan regarding extra-judicial killings in the state.
Around 3 August 2021 (as reported), the police forces severely beat up a woman in Monrovia city (Greater Monrovia, Montserrado) for not wearing a facemask in public. She lost a eye in the process.

On 3 August 2021, stability maintenance officials hired by a village secretary beat up a disabled woman near a secondary school in Dafeng district (Yancheng, Jiangsu) to stop her from taking a coronavirus test. The officials threw her to the ground from her electric wheelchair, slapped her face, and caused her injuries. It was reported that the woman was harassed by the officials many times.

On 2 August 2021, a female lawyer was arrested by the police from her home in Beijing municipality and placed residential surveillance in a designated location after she circulated a courtroom video posted online of a prosecutor admitting errors. She was transferred to a criminal detention facility on 29 August 2021.

On 1 August 2021, a Tibetan female school teacher was arrested and admitted to a hospital in Xining city, Qinghai (coded to Chengzhong), despite not being diagnosed with any illness. She had been gone missing and became incommunicado, as reported on 20 January 2022. The arrest followed the forced closure of the renowned Tibetan school Sengdruk Taktse in July 2021.

On 31 July 2021, a woman was beaten, allegedly police officers, inside a house in Phuthaditjhaba (Thabo Mofutsanyane, Free State). The officers had gone to the house to check on the woman's mother-in-law, and she was attacked after excusing herself from the room. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Democratic Republic of Congo (2019-)

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: On 25 July 2021, SNR agents abducted a woman in Bururi commune (Bururi, Bururi). Her husband, who was a soldier, was abducted and killed in 2016. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 22 July 2021, in Cardenas, Tabasco, a woman was beaten up by two municipal police officers after she was arrested in Colonia Pueblo Nuevo. The event was recorded on video and shared on social media.

On 22 July 2021, in General Jose de San Martin (Chaco), two police officers sexually assaulted a minor inside a police vehicle in the Las Palmeras neighborhood and were filmed by passersby, who also offered help to the girl. On 21 July 2021, military officers beat and seriously injured a woman for allegedly selling food in violation of the coronavirus restrictive measures in Namanve (Mukono, Central). No fatalities were reported.

Around 21 July 2021 (as reported), in Mingin township police station, Mingin town (Kale district, Sagaing region), the former chairwoman of the city development council who was first arrested and charged in March 2021 died in custody on 21 July after being denied medical treatment for diabetes and heart failure.

properties.notes: On 21 July 2021, police abducted two women, torturing one of them and releasing the other, in Mugamba commune (Mugamba, Bururi). On 20 July 2021, a police officer reportedly physically assaulted, beat and raped an 18-year-old female prisoner at a police station in Saratov. properties.assoc_actor_2_primary: PCRN: Cameroon Party for National Reconciliation
properties.notes: On 20 July 2021, the police forces assaulted a female PCRN (opposition) party MP in Bafoussam town, Bafoussam 1 (Mifi, Ouest) under unclear circumstances. [women targeted: politicians]

On 19 July 2021, a female resident of the Xojayli township in Republic of Karakalpakstan region was assaulted at the local police station by 3 policewomen and 1 representative of the town administration for protesting a week earlier. properties.actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
properties.notes: On 18 July 2021, in Manaus, Amazonas, a female lawyer was beaten up and injured inside a military police station by police forces as she was assisting an arrest case.

On 17 July 2021, police allegedly physically assaulted and beat a female journalist in Moscow - Central. According to the victim, the incident occurred after the journalist started filming the detention of a passerby by police.

On 16 July 2021, Police officers physically assaulted a pregnant resident of the house they raided as part of an 'anti-terrorism' operation in Turgut Ozal neighborhood of Idil town, Sirnak. The police officers reportedly butt-stroked the victim with the stocks of their weapons and dragged her along the floor by pulling her hair. The victim was hospitalized due to the violence she was subject to, which put her pregnancy and the life of the fetus at high risk.

On 16 July 2021, a female human rights defender from Yuzhong district, Chongqing was intercepted by petition interceptors in the Beijing municipality and sent to a 'black jail' in Beijing where she was detained until her release on 2 August 2021. Upon her release, she was repatriated to Chongqing but was forcibly taken to a hotel in Chongqing for COVID-19 quarantine. This followed another incident on 8 June where she was taken away by petition interceptors in Beijing. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Burundi (2005-) National Intelligence Service
properties.notes: On 16 July 2021, an SNR agent abducted a young woman in Gahama area of Mabanda (Makamba). She is the third person from the same family to be abducted in less than a month. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 16 July 2021 (month of), a female human rights defender, who was also a petitioner-cum-forced evictee, was taken away by the police in Shanghai municipality because she went to Beijing to submit petitions several times in the past six months. She was detained at a 'black jail' for 21 days. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 15 July 2021 (month of), in Soacha (Cundinamarca), two female applicants for police forces were sexually abused and suffered workplace harassment from one of their superiors. According to their testimony, the man frequently harassed the women by extending their work hours. Additionally, he demanded oral sex in return for a work license. The events occurred inside the police station of the municipality.

On 15 July 2021, Nazlymkhan Turumbetova, a female member of the illegal political party Alga, Karakalpakstan was detained and tortured via electrocution by policemen while in custody at the police station of the Takhiatash township in Xojayli district of Republic of Karakalpakstan to extract forced confession on organizing opposition protest two days earlier.
