On 14 July 2021, near Nwan Lang village, Momauk township (Bhamo district, Kachin state), one woman was raped and killed by 3 soldiers from Myanmar military forces. Three soldiers from the Myanmar military brigade 88 and LIB 616 were found with the dead woman's mobile phone. The Myanmar military paid 2,100,000 kyats to the victim's family in compensation.

Around 14 July 2021 (as reported), three police officers in Lichinga (Lichinga, Niassa), assaulted a 13-year-old-girl for alleged violation of coronavirus prevention measures. The girl was immobilized on a public road and the officers beat her with clubs. [women targeted: girls]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-) Gendarmerie
properties.assoc_actor_2_primary: URCA: Union for Central African Renewal
properties.notes: On 13 July 2021, a gendarmerie commando attacked an ex-leader of URCA in his house, raping and beating his wife, in Bangui - 3 (Arrondissement 3). The ex-leader of URCA managed to escape, and no fatalities were reported. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) National Intelligence and Security Agency
properties.assoc_actor_2_primary: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) National Intelligence and Security Agency
properties.notes: On 13 July 2021, government security forces (NISA) took a female NISA staff member from her home close to NISA HQ during the night in Mogadishu - Shibis (Banadir). The female staff member was in charge of NISA internet security. [women targeted: government officials]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Somalia (2017-2022) Jubaland Security Force
properties.notes: On 13 July 2021, a Jubaland soldier raped a young girl at his residence in the vicinity of Dhobley town (Afmadow, Lower Juba), who later scummed to her injuries while being taken to the nearby medical facility. Jubaland security forces publicly killed (executed) the soldier. [women targeted: girls]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Cuba (1959-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: On 12 July 2021, in Habana, La Habana, a female minor who was arrested in the '100 y Aldabo' prison for participating in the anti-government demonstrations of 11 July was forced by the prison guards to undress. The woman received sexual threats and abusive requests from the prison guards, including a senior official. No fatalities occurred. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders][women targeted: girls]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Cuba (1959-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: On 12 July 2021, in Habana, La Habana, prison guards forced a woman member of UNPACU, Cuba Decide and Ladies in White to undress during her detention. The woman was arrested during the anti-government demonstrations that occurred nationwide the day before. No fatalities occurred. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 11 July 2021, the mother of a law student allegedly killed by the police in May was shot and killed, allegedly by police at Ngwane Park, Manzini (Kwaluseni, Mazini). The student's mother was a key witness of the crime, which was one of the triggers for the series of demonstrations in the country in June. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Brazil (2019-) Municipal Guards
properties.notes: On 10 July 2021, in Piracicaba, Sao Paulo, a Black woman was hit by a rubber bullet fired from a municipal guard while she left the house of a neighbor. She lost her sight in one eye. The victim was community leader. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
properties.notes: On 9 July 2021, national military forces raped two women at a checkpoint in Ippy (Ouaka). No fatalities were reported.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of the Central African Republic (2016-)
properties.notes: On 9 July 2021, three FACA officers beat and raped a woman in Kaga-Bandoro (Nana-Grebizi). The victim was seriously injured.

On 7 July 2021, in Waingmaw township (Myitkyina District, Kachin State), a female street vendor who was selling fruits at a roadside market near Balaminhtin Bridge was shot and killed by a stray bullet fired by a group of military soldiers. The soldiers was reportedly firing at a vehicle that failed to stop for inspection.
properties.source: Kachin News Group; Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Canada (2015-) RCMP: Royal Canadian Mounted Police
properties.notes: On 6 July 2021, the RCMP killed a 44 year old woman at the Sandy Bay RCMP detachment in Sandy Bay (Saskatchewan) after the woman was taken into custody. The RCMP arrested the victim the previous day 'in relation to an ongoing investigation'. Three hours after being arrested, the woman was found unresponsive and died less than an hour later. One fatality.

On 5 July 2021, in Nyaung Kone village (Kawlin Township, Kawlin District, Sagaing Region), the Myanmar military raided villages and randomly fired gunshots. A woman in her 40s was shot dead in Nyaung Kone village. She was riding a motorbike on the Shwebo-Myitkyina highway with her child when soldiers in a military truck shot at them.
properties.source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Irrawaddy

properties.notes: On 5 July 2021, police seized a human rights defender's house and attacked his former wife at the property in Hebei district in Tianjin (Tianjin). The woman suffered bone fractures after being beaten up by the police. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Kyrgyzstan (2017-2020) State Committee for National Security
properties.notes: On 3 July 2021, a male officer of the State Committee for National Security sexually assaulted a female passenger in his personal automobile in the village of Besh-Kungey in Alamudun district of Chui region following which a victim filed a police report. Bishkek city police department opened a criminal case on attempted rape charge.

On 3 July 2021, in Moron, Ciego de Avila, Ciego de Avila, reportedly military officers beat a female social activist. The victim reported that the attackers were dressed as civilians but were recognized as military officers. After beating her, they escaped in a vehicle that was waiting for them. No fatalities. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

Around 2 July 2021 (as reported), in Ciudad Valles, San Luis Potosi, the Ciudad Valles police chief entered a home in Colonia Diana without apparently having a search warrant and beat a woman who told him that he could not enter without such a warrant. The attack was recorded and circulated on social networks. The victim was injured.
Around 2 July 2021 (as reported), a woman accused of murder was allegedly tortured and sexually assaulted by police while in custody at Ujirpur police station in Barisal city (Barisal Sadar).
properties.source: Dhaka Tribune; United News of Bangladesh; Daily Observer (Bangladesh); Daily Star (Bangladesh)

properties.notes: On 1 July 2021, regime forces stationed at a checkpoint near al Omari mosque in Kanaker in Dar'a discharged small arms fire wounding a woman. No fatalities were reported.

On 30 June 2021, an SSPDF Sergeant Major shot and killed a woman (presumed to be Malual Dinka) during a land dispute in the Ariath area of Aweil North county (Northern Bahr el Ghazal state). The soldier is in police custody.

On 28 June 2021, a female petitioner from Xiaogan, Hubei was intercepted by officials from her hometown while transiting at the bus station in Xiao village (Changping, Beijing). She was detained at the Hongbo Grand Hotel after they escorted her back to Xiaogan prefecture.

On 28 June 2021, Malian soldiers of the G5 Sahel Force shot at a group of pastoralist women in the hamlet of Boulmataka (Douentza, Mopti). Two girls were killed and two others were wounded. [women targeted: girls]

On 27 June 2021, early in the morning, around 15 young people, predominantly African, Arab and female, were verbally and physically assaulted in Milano by military Carabinieri in riot gear, who started using their clubs on some of them. The assault is alleged to be motivated by racism since they only engaged with the group to stop a boy ringing the bell of a scooter. The military claimed that they intervened because there was a brawl and the group was too loud, and that they threw bottles when questioned. A girl was reported injured. A boy was arrested and another boy was reported for resisting the police. [women targeted: girls]

On 26 June 2021, a female petitioner from Chongqing and her aunt were beaten up in a car in Jinshui district (Zhengzhou, Henan) by five to six interceptors from the Petitioning and Public Security Bureaus of Rongchang district, Chongqing. The interceptors were aiming to prevent the petitioner from taking her grievances to Beijing.

On 25 June 2021, more than 100 riot police and other officers carried out an operation to requisition a rice field on disputed farmland in Chuong village, Ly Nhan district (Ha Nam). The villagers, who also farm the land, scuffled with the authorities and one woman villager was hospitalized as a result.
On 23 June 2021, the military forces raided Bamenda town, Bamenda 1 subdivision (Mezam, Sud-Ouest). They shot and severely injured a pregnant woman.

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) Military Police
properties.notes: On 23 June 2021, in Salvador, Bahia, a civilian woman was shot and severely injured in the head by military police officers in the Novo Horizonte neighborhood. The victim was returning from a party with her sister, in her motorcycle, when she was shot and fell. Her sister claimed the military police officers who shot her then put her in their vehicles and took her to the hospital.

On 23 June 2021, the wife of a rights defender was captured from her residence in Caoyuancun village, Xi county (Xinyang, Henan) for the second time in a week by two police officers from Huaihe Police Station and detained in a local hotel for unreported reason. During her absence from home, stability maintenance officials destroyed security cameras in her house. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

Around 23 June 2021 (week of), police beat and lightly injured a member of OR: The Other Russia at a police station at an unspecified location in Moscow, allegedly after the woman refused to take off a necklace with a cross during a search. The OR: The Other Russia activist was detained earlier the same day for alleged refusal to obey police orders. [women targeted: political party supporters]

On 22 June 2021, a police officer escorting a patient with a mental health condition at a major hospital in Athens - Central Athens attacked her verbally and physically when she tried to stand up after she was sitting in the hospital waiting area for 3 hours. The police officer grabbed the patient by the hair, pushed her down, kicked her, and made her sit down again while slapping her. He was reported and sued by a doctor.

On 22 June 2021, a female suspect in fraud case was raped by a police officer at the police detention facility in Zaamin township of Dzhizak region following which victim filed a report resulting in a criminal investigation. Victim stated that she was raped repeatedly for days during her detention at the facility.

Around 22 June 2021 (as reported), a detained female Uyghur human rights defender was tortured while in detention in Xinjiang Women's Prison (Xinjiang No. 2 Prison) in Kashi East Road Residential District of Xinshi district (Urumqi, Xinjiang). She was sentenced to life in prison in 2010 for 'splittism, leaking state secrets, and organizing an illegal demonstration.' On 22 June 2021, the authorities reduced her life sentence to 19 years and 8 months after she signed a written statement of remorse in 2017. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

On 21 June 2021, the wife of a rights defender was captured from her residence in Caoyuancun village, Xi county (Xinyang, Henan) by two police officers from Huaihe Police Station and some community secretaries from Caoyuancun for unreported reason. She was detained in a hotel for a day before being allowed to return to her place of residence under surveillance on the following day. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Venezuela (1999-) CPNB: National Bolivarian Police
properties.notes: On 18 June 2021, in Puerto La Cruz (Anzoategui state), a woman was shot and killed by a CPNB officer at her residence, located in the Valle Lindo sector. It was reported the perpetrator escaped from the site on his motorcycle and turned himself in to municipal authorities thereafter. The motivation of the crime, however, is still unknown. 1 fatality.

On 17 June 2021, in Aing Gyi village (coded as Aing Gyi (Ywar Ma)) (Kawlin Township, Katha District, Sagaing Region), military soldiers stormed the village and opened fire as villagers fled in fear. A 50-year-old woman was shot and injured.

On 17 June 2021, SSPDF forces loyal to Maj. Gen. James Nando and affiliated militia (presumed to be Zande) attacked the villages of Akpa, Bazande (presumed to be Central Bazande) and Mabenge of Tambura county (Western Equatoria state), with sexual violence reported in Mabenge (with a girl described as being 'raped to death' by solders) as well as looting and burning of homes. At least eight people were reported to have been killed in the three locations and 2,000 displaced (one source says 21,000), with at least three people killed and two wounded in Mabenge, in addition to thirteen abducted (three women, and ten men). Eight fatalities distributed across three events. [women targeted: girls]
properties.source: Juba Monitor; Eye Radio (South Sudan); UNMISS

properties.notes: Around 17 June 2021 (as reported), over the past several days Pakistan military sexually assaulted a dozen women and shot dead a man for resisting in Nakshali Keelkor village in Panjgur district (Balochistan).

Around 16 June 2021 (as reported), police forces allegedly lathi-charged and forcefully evicted a group of women from their residences in Jaipur city (Rajasthan), for violating coronavirus protocols. No injuries or fatalities reported.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of the United States (2021-) Border Patrol
properties.notes: On 16 June 2021, a Mexican citizen was shot in the head by a U.S. Border Patrol agent in Nogales (Arizona). The woman had recently arrived in the United States as an undocumented immigrant and was sitting in the backseat of a car in Nogales when she was shot. According to the victim, a Border Patrol agent shot at the moving vehicle as the driver slowed down to yield to the officers' signal to pull over. The woman survived, but was left disabled by the severe injuries incurred by the attack. She filed a lawsuit against Customs and Border Patrol in December 2021. No public information was released regarding the Border Patrol and FBI investigations into the incident.
properties.source: Guardian (United Kingdom); San Diego Union-Tribune; News 4 Tucson

properties.notes: Around 15 June 2021 (as reported), in Santa Marta (Magdalena), police detained and beat up two women for not wearing masks during the ongoing coronavirus pandemic. 2 injured, no fatalities.

On 15 June 2021, officers from the Xinpaifang Police Station harassed and beat up an elderly woman in front of the Tiangongdian Police Station in Yubei district (Chongqing) under the orders of their station chief. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

Around 15 June 2021, police officers of the Pervomaisky district police station beat a female witness near Oktyabr district of Bishkek city which was reported by the country's Ombudsman's office resulting in re-investigation of the case.

On 15 June 2021, in Habana, La Habana, a woman was beaten up by police officers during the arrest of her partner and activist. The activist was arrested because he had recorded and posted on social networks a protest that had taken place a few days before in Habana. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

On 15 June 2021, 3 Manobo Lumad were killed by the military in Barangay Diatagon (Lianga, Surigao del Sur, Caraga). 2 of the slain Lumad were farmers, while 1 was a 12-year-old student. The slain Lumad farmers were also part of the local Lumad organization Malahutayong Pakigbisog alang sa Sumusunod (Mapasu). According to Lumad advocacy group Save Our Schools Network, 6 Lumad were at a farm harvesting abaca when the military opened fire; 3 Lumad managed to escape. However, the military claimed that the victims were NPA militants, and that the NPA was using the 12-year-old as a 'child warrior.' Save Our Schools Network and Karapatan reported that the genitalia of 2 of the victims - who were female, one being the minor while the other one being a lesbian - bore signs of rape. [women targeted: girls]
properties.source: Manila Bulletin; Philippine News Agency; GMA News; Philippine Daily Inquirer; Kodao Productions; Karapatan; ABS-CBN; Bulatlat

properties.notes: On 14 June 2021, in Manton township (Pa Laung Self-Administered Zone, Shan-North State), two ethnic Lisu women were raped by a military soldier while they were searching for mushrooms.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Mozambique (1990-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: Around 14 June 2021, prison guards in the Ndlavela Women's Penitentiary in Maputo (Maputo, Maputo City) were accused of maintaining a clandestine network of forced prostitution of female prisoners out of the penitentiary. A Commission of Inquiry analyzed the case and considered that there was no network of exploitation outside the prison but inside, suggesting practices of sexual exploitation involving prison guards.
properties.source: Zitamar; O Pais; VOA; Twitter; Televisao de Mozambique; AFP; Carta de Mocambique

properties.notes: On 13 June 2021, members of the military forces evacuated the disputed area of Shabakah close to Gadier (Ghadeer, South Kordofan) and used coercive force against civilians. One woman was shot and transferred to a hospital for treatment.

On 12 June 2021, presumably members of the Mozambican Defense and Security Forces killed eight women in Litamanda (Macomia, Cabo Delgado). A local mentioned that soldiers looked for members of an Islamist militia in the outskirts of the city on the same day that the bodies of the women were found. Reports differ about the civilians being shot or beheaded (following a killing pattern of the Islamist militia).
properties.source: Carta de Mocambique; VOA; Cabo Ligado

properties.notes: On 11 June 2021, police detained and later beat several women at a shelter for victims of domestic violence in Makhachkala, where they arrived after a lesbian woman from neighboring Chechnya had fled from her family and found refuge there.

On 11 June 2021, in Habana, La Habana, a woman was beaten up by police officers while she was being arrested. In the mean time, from their balconies, residents who were watching the scene shouted at the police to stop the beating.
On 11 June 2021, police officers manhandled, pepper sprayed and hit 5 women with batons at a Motherwell police station (Nelson Mandela Bay, Eastern Cape) as the group tried to report a crime.

On 11 June 2021, an elderly female petitioner was forcibly admitted to the No.1 Chenzhou Hospital in Beihu district (Chenzhou, Hunan) by stability maintenance officers. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 10 June 2021, seven to eight individuals snatched the phone of a citizen of Changzhou, Jiangsu near the Xiangtun Bus Station in Xingshou town (Changping, Beijing), and forcibly put her into a car with a Jiangsu license plate. She was taken to Super 8 Hotel on Xihuan Rd, where there were government officials and policemen from Luoxi town, Xinbei district and Changzhou prefecture. On 11 June, she was transferred to Erjia Hotel in Changzhou by a car with a Beijing license plate. By the end of the day, she was transferred away and lost contact. The incident was reported as one of a series of 'stability maintenance incidents' to portray prosperity ahead of the 100th anniversary of the establishment of the ruling Communist Party.

On 10 June 2021, the military forces shot and killed an old woman in Him village, Nwa subdivision (Donga-Mantung, Nord-Ouest). She is accused of collaborating with separatists fighters allegedly because her daughter married a separatist fighter. [women targeted: relatives of targeted groups or persons]

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Yemen (2016-) Supreme Political Council
properties.notes: On 8 June 2021, Houthi sniper fire targeted a civilian woman in front of her house in Wahir village (Jabal Habashy, Taizz) injuring her.
properties.source: Khabar News Agency (Yemen); Yemen Data Project

properties.actor1: Military Forces of Brazil (2019-) UPP: Pacifying Police Unit
properties.notes: On 8 June 2021, in Rio de Janeiro - North Zone, Rio de Janeiro, UPP military police shot and killed a Black, pregnant, civilian woman. According to witnesses, officers opened fire aimlessly, and there were no armed clash taking place. One resident informed that officers hid in her house, preparing an ambush against suspects. Officers also refused to help the woman, and they hid the used ammunition of their rifles to mislead investigations. According to military police, officers were attacked and shot back. They declared that they took the woman to hospital where she died. 21 weapons used by officers were seized for the investigation. 1 fatality.

On 8 June 2021, a female human rights defender from Yuzhong district, Chongqing was intercepted by petition interceptors in the Beijing municipality. She was sent to a 'black jail' in Chongqing where she was held until her release on 5 July 2021. [women targeted: activists/human rights defenders/social leaders]

properties.assoc_actor_2_primary: UNAB: National Unit Blue and White
properties.notes: On 8 June 2021, in Managua, Managua, around 30 police officers raided the house of a female political activist and member of the UNAB party. The activist was beaten by the officers during the raid and was informed that she was under house arrest after having been accused by the government of supporting foreign military invasions. On 11 June, officers took her from her house. Her whereabouts are unknown. This event takes place amid increased legislation and measures taken to repress political opposition ahead of the next general elections. [women targeted: political party supporters]

On 5 June 2021, in Bant Bway village (Yinmarbin Township, Yinmarbin District, Sagaing Region), Myanmar military stormed the village and opened fire. A female villager was shot and killed. One other civilian was arrested.
properties.source: Assistance Association for Political Prisoners; Democratic Voice of Burma

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Malaysia (2020-2021) Prison Guards
properties.notes: On 5 June 2021, a high-ranking police officer sexually assaulted a female prisoner at a police headquarters in Kota Bharu (Kelantan). He asked the victim to perform oral sex and intercourse if she wanted her case to be resolved. She had been arrested for a drug-related offense.

On 5 June 2021, in Yangon city (Yangon Region), the security forces (assumed to be the military and police) arrested a filmmaker at her house. She was beaten and seriously injured. Afterwards, she was hospitalized for 10 days.

Around 4 June 2021 (week of), in Nam Hpat Kar village (Kutkai township, Muse district, Shan-North), a 14-year-old ethnic Ta'ang Buddhist nun was raped twice by a soldier from Bridge-99 who was stationed at the monastery. She was offered 500,000 kyats and asked to leave the monastery out of fear that the news would spread. [women targeted: girls]
properties.source: Shwe Phee Myay News Agency; Shan Herald Agency for News

properties.notes: On 2 June 2021, two petitioners, who were a married couple, were forcibly taken away by 5-6 police officers and district committee officers from their house in Hongmiaozi Residential District of Saybag District (Urumqi, Xinjiang), during which the officers beat up the wife. The wife was then taken to a police station and threatened to delete her posts on social media about her suffering. Both of them ended up being detained at a 'black jail' in Cangfanggou for over eight months, as reported on 13 March 2022.

Around 1 June 2021 (as reported), a police officer assaulted a woman at a bus park with a cane in Bidur municipality-4 (Nuwakot district), reportedly following a dispute between a husband and a wife. Police are further investigating the incident.

properties.actor1: Police Forces of Turkey (2016-) Prison Guards
properties.notes: On 1 June 2021, a female prisoner was tortured by prison guards in Diyarbakir women prison (coded as Diyarbakir Prison Compound) in Kayapinar, Diyarbakir. Source reported that there were bruises, swellings, wounds and cuts all over the prisoner's body, including her face, back, arms and legs due to the physical violence she was subject to.
properties.source: ANF News; Human Rights Foundation of Turkey

properties.notes: On 1 June 2021, a minor girl was sexually assaulted by a military officer on a train near Lonand town (Satara, Maharashtra). [women targeted: girls]
